02c7872d64996b921664199a53af8226 (23:51): any idea when the next azureus release will be?
8fa2d0067f92fbec7c550e8068f91809 (23:52): ETA: RC end of month, stable next month
8fa2d0067f92fbec7c550e8068f91809 (23:52): but it usually takes longer than expected ^^
8fa2d0067f92fbec7c550e8068f91809 (23:59): btw, did you release an update to fix the GTK issue or why don't we get much complaints from FC users about it?
d8dc045b509f035f161dc090fd166e9e (00:04): or die a horrible death *scnr*
8fa2d0067f92fbec7c550e8068f91809 (00:06): void^, yeah... i told the ubuntu-dev guys yesterday... and they're aware of it (there's a bugreport)... but it isn't in their repo...
a74c07e77864c0915aebb3126b39f2c9 (00:27): green_: RC next week
a74c07e77864c0915aebb3126b39f2c9 (00:31): green_: you guys are using a gnu classpath compiled version of the jre right?
a74c07e77864c0915aebb3126b39f2c9 (00:33): how big are those libs
a74c07e77864c0915aebb3126b39f2c9 (00:33): and have you ever tried compiling azureus directly?
02c7872d64996b921664199a53af8226 (00:49): and we are using a natively compiled version of azureus
02c7872d64996b921664199a53af8226 (00:49): ]$ ls -l /usr/lib/gcj/azureus/Azureus2.jar.so
02c7872d64996b921664199a53af8226 (00:49): -rwxr-xr-x 1 root root 14239848 Jun  4 17:58 /usr/lib/gcj/azureus/Azureus2.jar.so
a74c07e77864c0915aebb3126b39f2c9 (00:49): java code compiled to exec?  or vm compiled
02c7872d64996b921664199a53af8226 (00:50): because our interpreter is slow, and we don't have a jit yet
a74c07e77864c0915aebb3126b39f2c9 (00:50): how does it perform compiled?
a74c07e77864c0915aebb3126b39f2c9 (00:50): speed, mem use?
02c7872d64996b921664199a53af8226 (00:51): there are some problems, but they have to do with bugs in our library code
02c7872d64996b921664199a53af8226 (00:51): but they aren't really serious
a74c07e77864c0915aebb3126b39f2c9 (00:51): very interesting
02c7872d64996b921664199a53af8226 (00:51): it's still quite a memory pig
a74c07e77864c0915aebb3126b39f2c9 (00:51): what's required to compile this puppy to an exec?
8fa2d0067f92fbec7c550e8068f91809 (00:52): gcj + classpath i'd say
02c7872d64996b921664199a53af8226 (00:52): the answer depends on some things.  what platform are you interested in trying this on?
a74c07e77864c0915aebb3126b39f2c9 (00:52): any really, but linux to start
02c7872d64996b921664199a53af8226 (00:52): The_8472: just gcj really, since it comes with a GNU Classpath derived library
02c7872d64996b921664199a53af8226 (00:53): Do you have Fedora Core handy?
8fa2d0067f92fbec7c550e8068f91809 (00:53): running it under cygwin might be an interesting idea ^^
02c7872d64996b921664199a53af8226 (00:53): Nolar: the easiest way to see this in action is to get Fedora Core 5, and build it from the source RPM file.

02c7872d64996b921664199a53af8226 (00:54): The source RPM contains azureus source code, and we compile that to .jar files with the Eclipse compiler, and then compile the .jar files directly to .so files with gcj.
02c7872d64996b921664199a53af8226 (00:54): but that's just one way of skinning the cat.
02c7872d64996b921664199a53af8226 (00:54): and it's the easiest way.
8fa2d0067f92fbec7c550e8068f91809 (00:54): isn't the FC5 az source a bit crippled?
8fa2d0067f92fbec7c550e8068f91809 (00:55): by removing plugin update features?
02c7872d64996b921664199a53af8226 (00:55): a few things.  one sec SIGKID
8fa2d0067f92fbec7c550e8068f91809 (00:55): renice the process :P
02c7872d64996b921664199a53af8226 (01:00): - using java-gnome to get themed icons
02c7872d64996b921664199a53af8226 (01:00): - removing the update mechanism
02c7872d64996b921664199a53af8226 (01:00): - removing the ability for users to install plugins
02c7872d64996b921664199a53af8226 (01:00): these last 2 changes are a little controversial
02c7872d64996b921664199a53af8226 (01:01): the fedora maintainers like them,
02c7872d64996b921664199a53af8226 (01:01): and there haven't been too many complaints.
02c7872d64996b921664199a53af8226 (01:01): They worries are mostly around security, and how to handle multi-user systems.
a74c07e77864c0915aebb3126b39f2c9 (01:01): #2 i can understand, but why #3?
a74c07e77864c0915aebb3126b39f2c9 (01:02): plugins can be installed both per-user and per-system
8fa2d0067f92fbec7c550e8068f91809 (01:02): yeah, but they are the reason why the 1st thing we tell users to do is to fetch the official tarball from azureus.sf.net
02c7872d64996b921664199a53af8226 (01:02): I forget the details of why.
02c7872d64996b921664199a53af8226 (01:02): I think maybe it was just easier at the time to disable the updates if you also disabled user plugins.
02c7872d64996b921664199a53af8226 (01:02): 'll look into it sometime soon.
a74c07e77864c0915aebb3126b39f2c9 (01:03): compiled az can load .jar plugins ok though?
02c7872d64996b921664199a53af8226 (01:03): change #1 is really nice for linux, since it makes azureus fit into the look & feel of the desktop
8fa2d0067f92fbec7c550e8068f91809 (01:03): i think the reason was that the plugin update messed with the plugins you include
a74c07e77864c0915aebb3126b39f2c9 (01:04): then plugins should have no problems running from ~/.azureus
02c7872d64996b921664199a53af8226 (01:04): azureus is running with 106MB resident right now
02c7872d64996b921664199a53af8226 (01:04): I'm seeding 3 , and downloading 1
02c7872d64996b921664199a53af8226 (01:05): the total process size is an enormous 866MB, but..
8fa2d0067f92fbec7c550e8068f91809 (01:05): could be less... but 106 is within the expected range
02c7872d64996b921664199a53af8226 (01:05): b) a lot of the 866MB is native libgcj code that is shared between apps
02c7872d64996b921664199a53af8226 (01:05): (since we've got a libgcj.so shared library, and aren't jitting all the code for each instance of a java program)
02c7872d64996b921664199a53af8226 (01:06): btw, I package azureus with a number of plugins already installed.
a74c07e77864c0915aebb3126b39f2c9 (01:09): which ones?
